Test Case Change Classification.Acceptance Criteria - Modified Content: Validate repository visibility settings (Public/Private) are applied correctly during creation and reflect the selected option post-creation.

Old Test Case Steps: 1. Login to GitHub with valid credentials. [Test Data- Email: valid@email.com, Password: validPassword] [Acceptance Criteria- AC-2]
2. Click on 'New repository' button. [Test Data- ] [Acceptance Criteria- AC-2]
3. Enter 'my-repo' in the Repository name field. [Test Data- Repository name: my-repo] [Acceptance Criteria- AC-2]
4. Enter 'Test repo' in the Description field. [Test Data- Description: Test repo] [Acceptance Criteria- AC-2]
5. Select 'Public' as the visibility option. [Test Data- Visibility: Public] [Acceptance Criteria- AC-2]
6. Click 'Create repository'. [Test Data- ] [Acceptance Criteria- AC-2]
New Modified Test Case Steps: 1. Login to GitHub with valid credentials. [Test Data- Email: valid@email.com, Password: validPassword] [Acceptance Criteria- AC-2]
2. Click on 'New repository' button. [Test Data- ] [Acceptance Criteria- AC-2]
3. Enter 'my-repo' in the Repository name field. [Test Data- Repository name: my-repo] [Acceptance Criteria- AC-2]
4. Enter 'Test repo' in the Description field. [Test Data- Description: Test repo] [Acceptance Criteria- AC-2]
5. Select 'Public' or 'Private' as the visibility option. [Test Data- Visibility: Public/Private] [Acceptance Criteria- AC-2]
6. Click 'Create repository'. [Test Data- ] [Acceptance Criteria- AC-2]
7. Verify that the repository visibility setting reflects the selected option post-creation. [Test Data- Visibility: Public/Private] [Acceptance Criteria- AC-2]
Old Expected Results: 2. 'Create a new repository' page is displayed.
6. Repository is created and user is redirected to the new repository page.
New Modified Expected Results: 1. User is logged in.
2. 'Create a new repository' page is displayed.
3. Repository name is accepted.
4. Description is accepted.
5. Visibility is set to Public or Private as selected.
6. Repository is created and user is redirected to the new repository page.
7. Repository visibility matches the selected option (Public/Private) after creation.
Test Case Impact Details.What changed in Test Cases Steps & Expec: Test steps and expected results were updated to explicitly test both 'Public' and 'Private' visibility options during repository creation and to verify that the repository's visibility matches the selected option after creation, in alignment with the new acceptance criteria.
